snippet: In a turnaround, both the mayor and the police commissioner now support changing a law that has been used to arrest thousands of people on marijuana charges.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column expresses surprise that both Mayor Michael R Bloomberg and New York City Police Commissioner Raymond W Kelly are supporting a proposed change in state law that would make public possession of less than one ounce of marijuana no longer a misdemeanor; says support is startling because both Bloomberg and Kelley have consistently defended arrests on pot possession charges as vital to public safety.
lead_paragraph: In a turnaround, both the mayor and the police commissioner now support changing a law that has been used to arrest thousands of people on marijuana charges.

headline.seo: Altering a Law the Police Use Prolifically
